    • Method Detail

      • remove

        public static <T> T[] remove(T[] arr,
             int index)
        This is a convenience method for remove(Object[], int, int) where count = 1.

      • remove

        public static <T> T[] remove(T[] arr,
             int index,
             int count)
        Removes elements from an array by creating a new array and copying remaining elements from the source array. To be precise, using the term "remove" is a misnomer, as Java arrays cannot change size.

        If count == 0, the array is fully copied and returned.

        Parameters:
        arr - an array reference
        index - index to begin removing elements. Range: 0 to arr.length - 1
        count - number of elements to remove. Must be non-negative.
        Returns:
        reference to newly allocated array
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if arr is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if index and count are invalid

      • newGenericArray

        public static <T> T[] newGenericArray(Class<T> componentClass,
                      int length)
        Dynamically creates a type-safe and type-correct Java array. Normally, it is non-trivial to allocate generic arrays.
        Parameters:
        componentClass - element type in new array
        length - number of elements in new array. Must be non-negative.
        Returns:
        reference to newly allocated array
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if componentClass is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if length is negative

      • append

        public static <T> T[] append(T[] arr,
             T newItem,
             T... newItemArr)
        This is a convenience method for insert(Object[], int, Object, Object...).

      • insert

        public static <T> T[] insert(T[] arr,
             int index,
             T newItem,
             T... newItemArr)
        Creates a new array, copies all elements from source array, then adds new items. To be precise, using the term "insert" is a misnomer, as Java array's cannot change size.
        Parameters:
        arr - an array reference
        index - index to insert new items. Range: 0 to arr.length
        newItem - first new item to insert; null is OK
        newItemArr - optional list of additional items to insert; nulls are OK
        Returns:
        reference to newly allocated array
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if arr is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if index is invalid
